Items.Title: Council Members
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Robert Levine, Congregation Rodeph Sholom, 7 West 83rd Street, New York, N.Y.   10024

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER ELDRIDGE
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Council Member Lloyd Henry

Council Member Freed moved that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 13, 1999 be adopted and printed by COUNCIL MEMBER CARRION
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Clarke moved that the Mintues of the Stated Meeting of Wednesday, October 13, 1999 be adopted as printed.

Communication from the Office of the Comptroller - Submitting a copy of the Comptroller's Comprehensive Annual Financial Report issued pursuant to Section 93L and Section 95 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

Items.Title:
Communication from the Board of Elections in the City of New York - Submitting the Certification of Election of EVA MOSKOWITZ, as the new Council Member of the 4TH COUNCILMANIC DISTRICT, NEW YORK COUNTY.

THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE DULY ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER EVA MOSKOWITZ TAKING HER OATH OF OFFICE
Items.MinutesNote: At this point the First Deputy City Clerk swore in Eva S. Moskowitz as the Council Member from the Fourth District.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

By The Speaker (Council Member Vallone):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 33-02 Broadway, Astoria, NY d/b/a/ Café Kolonaki, Inc. shall be subject to review by the Council.

General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permissible parking of vehicles when alternate sides of the street rules are in effect for purposes of street cleaning.

Resolution calling upon the City of New York to set aside fifteen percent of the monies received from the Federal Assets Forfeiture Fund to support anti-crime programs of community-based organizations as allowed by the "permissible pass-through" regulation of the United States Department of Justice.
Resolution mourning the death and celebrating the life of jazz legend Milt Jackson, who passed away on October 9, 1999.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION - Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs & International Intergroup Relations

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a plaza name, St. Patrick's Plaza, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, St. Patrick's Plaza, Brooklyn.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the members of the New York State Legislature to enact Assembly Bill No. 2913, introduced by Assemblyman John Ravitz, which would require judges to impose consecutive rather then concurrent sentences on convicted serial rapists.

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Penal Law to create a Penal Law Section which provides that a third conviction for violating Penal Law Section 220.03 constitute a Class D felony.

Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct an oversight hearing regarding Administration for Children's Services protocol for the training, supervision and discipline of staff at foster care homes in New York City.
Resolution calling upon the Governor, the State Legislature and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to stop using the East Harlem Facility at 100th Street and Lexington Avenue as a bus depot.
Items.MatterName: MTA to stop using East Harlem Facility as a bus depot.

Items.Title: Application no. 19995425 TCQ, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Café Kolonaki, Inc., to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 33-02 Broadway, Borough of Queens, Council District no. 22.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.

Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. Application C 980224 ZMM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter, concerning changes to the zoning map, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 5.

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 980225 ZSM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 8 to allow an attended accessory parking garage with a maximum capacity of 150 spaces .  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.

RAYMOND TEATUM, First Deputy City Clerk

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Mr. Green) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. 990218 ZSK pursuant to Sections 197-c and 197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 43, to modify bulk regulation srelated to FAR, height, open space and lot area per room.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by a vote of the Council pursuant to Section 197d(b)(3) of the Charter.

Zoning resolution amendment application no. 990217 ZRK pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the New York City Charter, concerning changes in the text of the zoning resultion, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 43, relating to a new special permit to allow CPC to modify certain bulk regulations.
Passed The Consent Agenda
